title: Quadratic residues and the Legendre symbol
content: If the congruence ` ( ( x ^ 2 ) mod p ) = ( n mod p ) ` has a solution we say that ` n ` is a _quadratic residue_ ` mod p `. If the congruence has no solution we say that ` n ` is a _quadratic nonresidue_ ` mod p `, see definition in [ApostolNT] p. 178. The _Legendre symbol_ ` ( n /L p ) ` is defined in a way that its value is ` 1 ` if ` n ` is a quadratic residue ` mod p ` and ` -u 1 ` if ` n ` is a quadratic nonresidue ` mod p ` (and ` 0 ` if ` p ` divides ` n `), see ~ lgsqr . Originally, the Legendre symbol ` ( N /L P ) ` was defined for odd primes ` P ` only (and arbitrary integers ` N `) by Adrien-Marie Legendre in 1798, see definition in [ApostolNT] p. 179. It was generalized to be defined for any positive odd integer by Carl Gustav Jacob Jacobi in 1837 (therefore called "Jacobi symbol" since then), see definition in [ApostolNT] p. 188. Finally, it was generalized to be defined for any integer by Leopold Kronecker in 1885 (therefore called "Kronecker symbol" since then). The definition ~ df-lgs for the "Legendre symbol" ` /L ` is actually the definition of the "Kronecker symbol". Since only one definition (and one class symbol) are provided in set.mm, the names "Legendre symbol", "Jacobi symbol" and "Kronecker symbol" are used synonymously for ` /L `, but mostly it is called "Legendre symbol", even if it is used in the context of a "Jacobi symbol" or "Kronecker symbol".

df-lgs
blocks.content: Define the Legendre symbol (actually the Kronecker symbol, which extends the Legendre symbol to all integers, and also the Jacobi symbol, which restricts the Kronecker symbol to positive odd integers). See definition in [ApostolNT] p. 179 resp. definition in [ApostolNT] p. 188. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: zabsle1
blocks.content: ` { -u 1 , 0 , 1 } ` is the set of all integers with absolute value at most ` 1 ` . (Contributed by AV, 13-Jul-2021.)

blocks.name: lgslem1
blocks.content: When ` a ` is coprime to the prime ` p ` , ` a ^ ( ( p - 1 ) / 2 ) ` is equivalent ` mod p ` to ` 1 ` or ` -u 1 ` , and so adding ` 1 ` makes it equivalent to ` 0 ` or ` 2 ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Feb-2015.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: lgsfcl2

thm lgsfcl2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {

  -| wceq(c3, crab(s1, cz, wbr(cfv(cabs, cv(s1)), cle, nat1)))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)

  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wne(c1, nat0)), wf(c2, cn, c3)), diffss(s0, s1))
  a1ii(wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wne(c1, nat0)), wf(c2, cn, c3)), diffsc(s1, c1))

thm lgscllem(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ)→(c0[/L]c1)∈ c2)
  ⊣ c3 =(s0 ∈ ℕ ↦ if(s0 ∈ Prime,(if(s0 = 2, if(2[||]c0, 0, if((c0[mod]8)∈ { 1, 7 }, 1, -u(1))),((((c0[^]((s0[-]1)[÷]2))[+]1)[mod]s0)[-]1))[^](s0[pCnt]c1)), 1))
  ⊣ c2 = { s1 ∈ ℤ |(abs ` s1)[≤]1 }
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
} = {
  eqeltrd((c0[/L]c1), c2, if(c1 = 0, if((c0[^]2)= 1, 1, 0),(if((c1[<]0 ∧ c0[<]0), -u(1), 1)[×](seq(1(×, c3))`(abs ` c1)))), (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ))
  lgsval(s0, c0, c1, c3)
  ifclda(if((c0[^]2)= 1, 1, 0), (if((c1[<]0 ∧ c0[<]0), -u(1), 1)[×](seq(1(×, c3))`(abs ` c1))), c2, (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), c1 = 0)
  a1i(((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ)∧ c1 = 0), if((c0[^]2)= 1, 1, 0)∈ c2)
  ifcli(nat1, nat0, c2, (c0[^]2)= 1)
  simp2i(0 ∈ c2, -u(1)∈ c2, 1 ∈ c2)
  sylancr(((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ)∧ ¬ c1 = 0), (if((c1[<]0 ∧ c0[<]0), -u(1), 1)[×](seq(1(×, c3))`(abs ` c1)))∈ c2, if((c1[<]0 ∧ c0[<]0), -u(1), 1)∈ c2, (seq(1(×, c3))`(abs ` c1))∈ c2)
  ifcli(-u(1), nat1, c2, (c1[<]0 ∧ c0[<]0))
  simp1i(-u(1)∈ c2, 0 ∈ c2, 1 ∈ c2)
  simp3i(1 ∈ c2, -u(1)∈ c2, 0 ∈ c2)
  lgslem2(s1, c2)
  seqcl(hs0, hs1, nat1, cmul, c3, (abs ` c1), c2, ((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ)∧ ¬ c1 = 0))
  syl6eleq((abs ` c1), (ℤ≥ ` 1), cn, ((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ)∧ ¬ c1 = 0))
  syl2anc(((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ)∧ ¬ c1 = 0), (abs ` c1)∈ ℕ, c1 ∈ ℤ, c1 ≠ 0)
  simplr(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℤ, ¬ c1 = 0)
  neqned(c1, nat0, ((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ)∧ ¬ c1 = 0))
  simpr((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), ¬ c1 = 0)
  nnabscl(c1)
  nnuz()
  syl2an(((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ)∧ ¬ c1 = 0), hs0 ∈(1[...](abs ` c1)), (c3 ` hs0)∈ c2, (c3 : ℕ → c2), hs0 ∈ ℕ)
  sylan2br((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), ¬ c1 = 0, (c3 : ℕ → c2), c1 ≠ 0)
  df-ne(c1, nat0)
  3expa(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℤ, c1 ≠ 0, (c3 : ℕ → c2))
  lgsfcl2(s0, s1, c0, c1, c3, c2)
  elfznn(hs0, (abs ` c1))
  ffvelrn(c3, cn, c2, hs0)
  adantl(((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ)∧ ¬ c1 = 0), (hs0 ∈ c2 ∧ hs1 ∈ c2), (hs0[×]hs1)∈ c2)
  lgslem3(s1, hs0, c2, hs1)
  lgslem3(s1, if((c1[<]0 ∧ c0[<]0), -u(1), 1), c2, (seq(1(×, c3))`(abs ` c1)))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)

  diff.hs0.c(c3)

  diff.hs1.w(((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ)∧ ¬ c1 = 0))

  diff.co.s(s0, if(hs0 = 2, if(2[||]c0, 0, if((c0[mod]8)∈ { 1, 7 }, 1, -u(1))),((((c0[^]((hs0[-]1)[÷]2))[+]1)[mod]hs0)[-]1)), cexp, (hs0[pCnt]c1))
  diff.cif.s(s0, if(2[||]c0, 0, if((c0[mod]8)∈ { 1, 7 }, 1, -u(1))), ((((c0[^]((hs0[-]1)[÷]2))[+]1)[mod]hs0)[-]1), hs0 = 2)

blocks.name: lgs0

blocks.name: lgscl

blocks.name: lgsle1
blocks.content: The Legendre symbol has absolute value less than or equal to 1. Together with ~ lgscl this implies that it takes values in ` { -u 1 , 0 , 1 } ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Feb-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm lgsle1(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cle, nat1))
} = {
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cle, nat1), wcel(co(c0, clgs, c1), crab(hs0, cz, wbr(cfv(cabs, cv(hs0)), cle, nat1))))
  lgscl2(hs0, c0, c1, crab(hs0, cz, wbr(cfv(cabs, cv(hs0)), cle, nat1)))
  eqid(crab(hs0, cz, wbr(cfv(cabs, cv(hs0)), cle, nat1)))
  simprbi(wcel(co(c0, clgs, c1), crab(hs0, cz, wbr(cfv(cabs, cv(hs0)), cle, nat1))), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cle, nat1), wcel(co(c0, clgs, c1), cz))
  elrab(hs0, co(c0, clgs, c1), cz, wbr(cfv(cabs, cv(hs0)), cle, nat1), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cle, nat1))
  breq1d(cfv(cabs, cv(hs0)), cle, nat1, cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), wceq(cv(hs0), co(c0, clgs, c1)))
  fveq2(cv(hs0), co(c0, clgs, c1), cabs)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(co(c0, clgs, c1))
  diff.hs0.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.w(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cle, nat1))
}

thm lgsle1(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ)→(abs `(c0[/L]c1))[≤]1)
} = {
  syl((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ ℤ), (abs `(c0[/L]c1))[≤]1, (c0[/L]c1)∈ { hs0 ∈ ℤ |(abs ` hs0)[≤]1 })
  lgscl2(hs0, c0, c1, { hs0 ∈ ℤ |(abs ` hs0)[≤]1 })
  eqid({ hs0 ∈ ℤ |(abs ` hs0)[≤]1 })
  simprbi((c0[/L]c1)∈ { hs0 ∈ ℤ |(abs ` hs0)[≤]1 }, (abs `(c0[/L]c1))[≤]1, (c0[/L]c1)∈ ℤ)
  elrab(hs0, (c0[/L]c1), cz, (abs ` hs0)[≤]1, (abs `(c0[/L]c1))[≤]1)
  breq1d((abs ` hs0), cle, nat1, (abs `(c0[/L]c1)), hs0 =(c0[/L]c1))
  fveq2(hs0, (c0[/L]c1), cabs)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c((c0[/L]c1))
  diff.hs0.c(cz)
  diff.hs0.w((abs `(c0[/L]c1))[≤]1)
}

blocks.name: lgsvalmod
blocks.content: The Legendre symbol is equivalent to ` a ^ ( ( p - 1 ) / 2 ) ` , ` mod p ` . This theorem is also called "Euler's criterion", see theorem 9.2 in [ApostolNT] p. 180, or a representation of Euler's criterion using the Legendre symbol, see also ~ lgsqr . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: lgscl1
blocks.content: The value of the Legendre symbol is either -1 or 0 or 1. (Contributed by AV, 13-Jul-2021.)

blocks.name: lgsneg
blocks.content: The Legendre symbol is either even or odd under negation with respect to the second parameter according to the sign of the first. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: lgsneg1

blocks.name: lgsdilem
blocks.content: Lemma for ~ lgsdi and ~ lgsdir : the sign part of the Legendre symbol is multiplicative. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Feb-2015.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: lgsdirprm
blocks.content: The Legendre symbol is completely multiplicative at the primes. See theorem 9.3 in [ApostolNT] p. 180. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Feb-2015.) (Proof shortened by AV, 18-Mar-2022.)

blocks.name: lgsdir
blocks.content: The Legendre symbol is completely multiplicative in its left argument. Generalization of theorem 9.9(a) in [ApostolNT] p. 188 (which assumes that ` A ` and ` B ` are odd positive integers). Together with ~ lgsqr this implies that the product of two quadratic residues or nonresidues is a residue, and the product of a residue and a nonresidue is a nonresidue. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Feb-2015.)

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c2, cz))
  -| wi(w0, wne(c1, nat0))

  -| wceq(c0, cmpt(s0, cn, cif(co(co(c3, clgs, cv(s0)), cexp, co(cv(s0), cpc, c1)), nat1, wcel(cv(s0), cprime))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cseq(nat1, cmul, c0), cfv(cabs, c1)), cfv(cseq(nat1, cmul, c0), cfv(cabs, co(c1, cmul, c2))))), diffsc(s0, c2))
  seqid2(hs0, nat1, cmul, c0, cfv(cabs, c1), cfv(cabs, co(c1, cmul, c2)), cc, nat1, w0)
  adantl(w0, wcel(cv(hs0), cc), wceq(co(cv(hs0), cmul, nat1), cv(hs0)))
  mulid1(cv(hs0))
  syl3anbrc(w0, wcel(cfv(cabs, co(c1, cmul, c2)), cfv(cuz, cfv(cabs, c1))), wcel(cfv(cabs, c1), cz), wcel(cfv(cabs, co(c1, cmul, c2)), cz), wbr(cfv(cabs, c1), cle, cfv(cabs, co(c1, cmul, c2))))
  nnzd(cfv(cabs, co(c1, cmul, c2)), w0)

  zmulcld(c1, c2, w0)
  mulne0d(c1, c2, w0)
  nnabscl(co(c1, cmul, c2))
  breqtrrd(cfv(cabs, c1), cle, cfv(cabs, co(c1, cmul, c2)), co(cfv(cabs, c1), cmul, cfv(cabs, c2)), w0)
  lemulge11d(cfv(cabs, c1), cfv(cabs, c2), w0)
  abscld(c2, w0)

  nnge1d(cfv(cabs, c2), w0)
  syl2anc(w0, wcel(cfv(cabs, c2), cn), wcel(c2, cz), wne(c2, nat0))
  nnabscl(c2)
  absmuld(c1, c2, w0)
  zcnd(c2, w0)
  eluz2(cfv(cabs, co(c1, cmul, c2)), cfv(cabs, c1))

blocks.name: lgsdi
blocks.content: The Legendre symbol is completely multiplicative in its right argument. Generalization of theorem 9.9(b) in [ApostolNT] p. 188 (which assumes that ` M ` and ` N ` are odd positive integers). (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: lgsne0
blocks.content: The Legendre symbol is nonzero (and hence equal to ` 1 ` or ` -u 1 ` ) precisely when the arguments are coprime. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-Feb-2015.)

  diff.hs2.w(wne(cv(hs1), nat0))
  diff.hs2.c(cv(hs4))
  diff.hs2.w(wne(cv(hs4), nat0))
  diff.hs2.c(co(cv(hs1), cmul, cv(hs4)))
  diff.hs2.w(wne(co(cv(hs1), cmul, cv(hs4)), nat0))
  diff.hs2.c(cfv(cseq(nat1, cmul, cmpt(hs0, cn, cif(co(co(c0, clgs, cv(hs0)), cexp, co(cv(hs0), cpc, c1)), nat1, wcel(cv(hs0), cprime)))), cfv(cabs, c1)))
  diff.hs2.w(wne(cfv(cseq(nat1, cmul, cmpt(hs0, cn, cif(co(co(c0, clgs, cv(hs0)), cexp, co(cv(hs0), cpc, c1)), nat1, wcel(cv(hs0), cprime)))), cfv(cabs, c1)), nat0))
}

blocks.name: lgsabs1
blocks.content: The Legendre symbol is nonzero (and hence equal to ` 1 ` or ` -u 1 ` ) precisely when the arguments are coprime. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-Feb-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm lgsabs1(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wb(wceq(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), nat1), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
} = {
  3bitr2d(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wceq(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), nat1), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1), wa(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cle, nat1), wbr(nat1, cle, cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)))), wbr(nat1, cle, cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1))))
  sylancl(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wb(wceq(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), nat1), wa(wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cle, nat1), wbr(nat1, cle, cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1))))), wcel(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cr), wcel(nat1, cr))
  abscld(co(c0, clgs, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)))
  1re()
  letri3(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), nat1)
  biantrurd(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wbr(nat1, cle, cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1))), wbr(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cle, nat1))
  lgsle1(c0, c1)
  3bitr3d(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wbr(nat1, cle, cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1))), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1), wcel(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cn), wne(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), nat0))
  impbid2(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wcel(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cn), wne(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), nat0))
  nnne0(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)))
  necon1ad(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), nat0, wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wcel(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cn))
  ord(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wcel(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cn), wceq(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), nat0))
  sylib(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wo(wcel(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cn), wceq(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), nat0)), wcel(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cn0))
  elnn0(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wb(wcel(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cn), wbr(nat1, cle, cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)))), wcel(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cn0))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wcel(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cn0), wcel(co(c0, clgs, c1), cz))
  nn0abscl(co(c0, clgs, c1))
  baib(wcel(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cn0), wcel(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cn), wbr(nat1, cle, cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1))))
  elnnnn0c(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)))
  bitrd(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wne(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), nat0), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1), wne(co(c0, clgs, c1), nat0))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)), wb(wne(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), nat0), wne(co(c0, clgs, c1), nat0)), wcel(co(c0, clgs, c1), cc))
  zcnd(co(c0, clgs, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz)))
  lgscl(c0, c1)
  necon3bid(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), nat0, co(c0, clgs, c1), nat0, wcel(co(c0, clgs, c1), cc))
  abs00(co(c0, clgs, c1))

blocks.name: lgssq
blocks.content: The Legendre symbol at a square is equal to ` 1 ` . Together with ~ lgsmod this implies that the Legendre symbol takes value ` 1 ` at every quadratic residue. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-Feb-2015.) (Revised by AV, 20-Jul-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm lgssq(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(w3a(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)), wceq(co(co(c0, cexp, nat2), clgs, c1), nat1))
} = {
  3eqtr4d(co(co(c0, cexp, nat2), clgs, c1), nat1, co(co(c0, cmul, c0), clgs, c1), co(co(c0, clgs, c1), cmul, co(c0, clgs, c1)), w3a(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  syl32anc(w3a(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)), wceq(co(co(c0, cmul, c0), clgs, c1), co(co(c0, clgs, c1), cmul, co(c0, clgs, c1))), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wne(c0, nat0), wne(c0, nat0))
  simp1r(wcel(c0, cz), wne(c0, nat0), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1))
  lgsdir(c0, c0, c1)
  oveq1d(co(c0, cexp, nat2), clgs, c1, co(c0, cmul, c0), w3a(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  sqvald(c0, w3a(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  3ad2ant1(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1), wcel(c0, cc))
  adantr(wcel(c0, cz), wne(c0, nat0), wcel(c0, cc))
  zcn(c0)
  3eqtr3d(nat1, co(co(c0, clgs, c1), cmul, co(c0, clgs, c1)), co(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cexp, nat2), co(co(c0, clgs, c1), cexp, nat2), w3a(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  syl(w3a(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)), wceq(co(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cexp, nat2), co(co(c0, clgs, c1), cexp, nat2)), wcel(co(c0, clgs, c1), cr))
  zred(co(c0, clgs, c1), w3a(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  absresq(co(c0, clgs, c1))
  syl6eq(co(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cexp, nat2), nat1, co(nat1, cexp, nat2), w3a(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  oveq1d(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cexp, nat2, nat1, w3a(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  biimp3ar(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1), wceq(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), nat1))
  adantlr(wcel(c0, cz), wne(c0, nat0), wcel(c1, cz), wb(wceq(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), nat1), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  lgsabs1(c0, c1)
  sq1()
  sqvald(co(c0, clgs, c1), w3a(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  zcnd(co(c0, clgs, c1), w3a(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  syl2anc(w3a(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)), wcel(co(c0, clgs, c1), cz), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz))
  simp1l(wcel(c0, cz), wne(c0, nat0), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1))
  simp2(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wne(c0, nat0)), wcel(c1, cz), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1))
  lgscl(c0, c1)
}

blocks.name: lgssq2
blocks.content: The Legendre symbol at a square is equal to ` 1 ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-Feb-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm lgssq2(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)), wceq(co(c0, clgs, co(c1, cexp, nat2)), nat1))
} = {
  3eqtr4d(co(c0, clgs, co(c1, cexp, nat2)), nat1, co(c0, clgs, co(c1, cmul, c1)), co(co(c0, clgs, c1), cmul, co(c0, clgs, c1)), w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  syl32anc(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)), wceq(co(c0, clgs, co(c1, cmul, c1)), co(co(c0, clgs, c1), cmul, co(c0, clgs, c1))), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wne(c1, nat0), wne(c1, nat0))
  3ad2ant2(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1), wne(c1, nat0))
  nnne0(c1)
  lgsdi(c0, c1, c1)
  oveq2d(c0, clgs, co(c1, cexp, nat2), co(c1, cmul, c1), w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  sqvald(c1, w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  3ad2ant2(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1), wcel(c1, cc))
  nncn(c1)
  3eqtr3d(nat1, co(co(c0, clgs, c1), cmul, co(c0, clgs, c1)), co(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cexp, nat2), co(co(c0, clgs, c1), cexp, nat2), w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  syl(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)), wceq(co(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cexp, nat2), co(co(c0, clgs, c1), cexp, nat2)), wcel(co(c0, clgs, c1), cr))
  zred(co(c0, clgs, c1), w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  absresq(co(c0, clgs, c1))
  syl6eq(co(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cexp, nat2), nat1, co(nat1, cexp, nat2), w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  oveq1d(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), cexp, nat2, nat1, w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  biimp3ar(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1), wceq(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), nat1))
  sylan2(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn), wb(wceq(cfv(cabs, co(c0, clgs, c1)), nat1), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)), wcel(c1, cz))
  lgsabs1(c0, c1)
  sq1()
  sqvald(co(c0, clgs, c1), w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  zcnd(co(c0, clgs, c1), w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)))
  syl2anc(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)), wcel(co(c0, clgs, c1), cz), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz))
  simp1(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1))
  3ad2ant2(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cn), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1), wcel(c1, cz))

blocks.name: lgsprme0
blocks.content: The Legendre symbol at any prime (even at 2) is ` 0 ` iff the prime does not divide the first argument. See definition in [ApostolNT] p. 179. (Contributed by AV, 20-Jul-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm lgsprme0(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cprime)), wb(wceq(co(c0, clgs, c1), nat0), wceq(co(c0, cmo, c1), nat0)))
} = {
  necon4abid(co(c0, clgs, c1), nat0, wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cprime)), wceq(co(c0, cmo, c1), nat0))
  3bitrd(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cprime)), wne(co(c0, clgs, c1), nat0), wn(wceq(co(c0, cmo, c1), nat0)), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1), wn(wbr(c1, cdvds, c0)))
  sylan2(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cprime), wb(wne(co(c0, clgs, c1), nat0), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1)), wcel(c1, cz))
  lgsne0(c0, c1)
  bitr2d(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cprime)), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c1), nat1), wn(wbr(c1, cdvds, c0)), wceq(co(c1, cgcd, c0), nat1))
  ancoms(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cprime), wb(wn(wbr(c1, cdvds, c0)), wceq(co(c1, cgcd, c0), nat1)))
  coprm(c1, c0)
  eqeq1d(co(c1, cgcd, c0), nat1, co(c0, cgcd, c1), wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cprime)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cprime)), wceq(co(c1, cgcd, c0), co(c0, cgcd, c1)), wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cz)))
  ancoms(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cprime), wa(wcel(c1, cz), wcel(c0, cz)))
  anim1i(wcel(c1, cprime), wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz))
  prmz(c1)
  gcdcom(c1, c0)
  notbid(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cprime)), wbr(c1, cdvds, c0), wceq(co(c0, cmo, c1), nat0))
  ancoms(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cprime), wb(wbr(c1, cdvds, c0), wceq(co(c0, cmo, c1), nat0)))
  sylan(wcel(c1, cprime), wcel(c0, cz), wb(wbr(c1, cdvds, c0), wceq(co(c0, cmo, c1), nat0)), wcel(c1, cn))
  prmnn(c1)
  dvdsval3(c1, c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm lgsprme0(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ Prime)→((c0[/L]c1)= 0 ↔(c0[mod]c1)= 0))
} = {
  necon4abid((c0[/L]c1), nat0, (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ Prime), (c0[mod]c1)= 0)
  3bitrd((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ Prime), (c0[/L]c1)≠ 0, ¬(c0[mod]c1)= 0, (c0[gcd]c1)= 1, ¬ c1[||]c0)
  sylan2(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ Prime, ((c0[/L]c1)≠ 0 ↔(c0[gcd]c1)= 1), c1 ∈ ℤ)
  lgsne0(c0, c1)
  bitr2d((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ Prime), (c0[gcd]c1)= 1, ¬ c1[||]c0, (c1[gcd]c0)= 1)
  ancoms(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ Prime, (¬ c1[||]c0 ↔(c1[gcd]c0)= 1))
  coprm(c1, c0)
  eqeq1d((c1[gcd]c0), nat1, (c0[gcd]c1), (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ Prime))
  syl((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ Prime), (c1[gcd]c0)=(c0[gcd]c1), (c1 ∈ ℤ ∧ c0 ∈ ℤ))
  ancoms(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ Prime, (c1 ∈ ℤ ∧ c0 ∈ ℤ))
  anim1i(c1 ∈ Prime, c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℤ)
  prmz(c1)
  gcdcom(c1, c0)
  notbid((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈ Prime), c1[||]c0, (c0[mod]c1)= 0)
  ancoms(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ Prime, (c1[||]c0 ↔(c0[mod]c1)= 0))
  sylan(c1 ∈ Prime, c0 ∈ ℤ, (c1[||]c0 ↔(c0[mod]c1)= 0), c1 ∈ ℕ)
  prmnn(c1)
  dvdsval3(c1, c0)
}

blocks.name: 1lgs

  1gcd(c0)
  mp3an1(wcel(c0, cz), wceq(co(nat1, cgcd, c0), nat1), wceq(co(co(nat1, cexp, nat2), clgs, c0), nat1), wa(wcel(nat1, cz), wne(nat1, nat0)))
  pm3.2i(wcel(nat1, cz), wne(nat1, nat0))

blocks.name: lgs1

blocks.name: lgsmodeq
blocks.content: The Legendre (Jacobi) symbol is preserved under reduction ` mod n ` when ` n ` is odd. Theorem 9.9(c) in [ApostolNT] p. 188. (Contributed by AV, 20-Jul-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm lgsmodeq(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wa(wcel(c2, cn), wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, c2)))), wi(wceq(co(c0, cmo, c2), co(c1, cmo, c2)), wceq(co(c0, clgs, c2), co(c1, clgs, c2))))
} = {
  ex(w3a(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cz), wa(wcel(c2, cn), wn(wbr(nat2, cdvds, c2)))), wceq(co(c0, cmo, c2), co(c1, cmo, c2)), wceq(co(c0, clgs, c2), co(c1, clgs, c2)))

blocks.name: lgsmulsqcoprm
blocks.content: The Legendre (Jacobi) symbol is preserved under multiplication with a square of an integer coprime to the second argument. Theorem 9.9(d) in [ApostolNT] p. 188. (Contributed by AV, 20-Jul-2021.)

  3adant3(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wne(c0, nat0)), wa(wcel(c1, cz), wne(c1, nat0)), wa(wcel(c2, cz), wceq(co(c0, cgcd, c2), nat1)), wa(wne(co(c0, cexp, nat2), nat0), wne(c1, nat0)))

blocks.name: lgsdinn0
blocks.content: Variation on ~ lgsdi valid for all ` M , N ` but only for positive ` A ` . (The exact location of the failure of this law is for ` A = -u 1 ` , ` M = 0 ` , and some ` N ` in which case ` ( -u 1 /L 0 ) = 1 ` but ` ( -u 1 /L N ) = -u 1 ` when ` -u 1 ` is not a quadratic residue mod ` N ` .) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2016.)

blocks.name: lgsqr
blocks.content: The Legendre symbol for odd primes is ` 1 ` iff the number is not a multiple of the prime (in which case it is ` 0 ` , see ~ lgsne0 ) and the number is a quadratic residue ` mod P ` (it is ` -u 1 ` for nonresidues by the process of elimination from ~ lgsabs1 ). Given our definition of the Legendre symbol, this theorem is equivalent to Euler's criterion. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Jun-2015.)

blocks.name: lgsqrmod
blocks.content: If the Legendre symbol of an integer for an odd prime is ` 1 ` , then the number is a quadratic residue ` mod P ` . (Contributed by AV, 20-Aug-2021.)
blocks.origin:
thm lgsqrmod(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cdif(cprime, csn(nat2)))), wi(wceq(co(c0, clgs, c1), nat1), wrex(s0, cz, wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmo, c1), co(c0, cmo, c1)))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  sylbid(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cdif(cprime, csn(nat2)))), wceq(co(c0, clgs, c1), nat1), wrex(s0, cz, wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmo, c1), co(c0, cmo, c1))), wa(wn(wbr(c1, cdvds, c0)), wrex(s0, cz, wbr(c1, cdvds, co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmin, c0)))))
  lgsqr(s0, c0, c1)
  adantld(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cdif(cprime, csn(nat2)))), wn(wbr(c1, cdvds, c0)), wrex(s0, cz, wbr(c1, cdvds, co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmin, c0))), wrex(s0, cz, wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmo, c1), co(c0, cmo, c1))))
  reximdva(s0, cz, wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cdif(cprime, csn(nat2)))), wbr(c1, cdvds, co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmin, c0)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmo, c1), co(c0, cmo, c1)))
  biimprd(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cdif(cprime, csn(nat2)))), wcel(cv(s0), cz)), wbr(c1, cdvds, co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmin, c0)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmo, c1), co(c0, cmo, c1)))
  syl3anc(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cdif(cprime, csn(nat2)))), wcel(cv(s0), cz)), wb(wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmo, c1), co(c0, cmo, c1)), wbr(c1, cdvds, co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmin, c0))), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cz), wcel(c0, cz))
  ad2antlr(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cdif(cprime, csn(nat2))), wcel(cv(s0), cz), wcel(c1, cn))
  syl(wcel(c1, cdif(cprime, csn(nat2))), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(c1, cprime))
  eldifi(c1, cprime, csn(nat2))
  prmnn(c1)
  adantl(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cdif(cprime, csn(nat2)))), wcel(cv(s0), cz), wcel(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cz))
  zsqcl(cv(s0))
  simpll(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cdif(cprime, csn(nat2))), wcel(cv(s0), cz))
  moddvds(c1, co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), c0)

  diff.cz.s(s0)

  diff.cdif.s(s0, cprime, csn(nat2))
  diff.cprime.s(s0)
  diff.csn.s(s0, nat2)
  diff.nat2.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm lgsqrmod(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈(Prime \ { 2 }))→((c0[/L]c1)= 1 → ∃(s0 ∈ ℤ,((s0[^]2)[mod]c1)=(c0[mod]c1))))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
} = {
  sylbid((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈(Prime \ { 2 })), (c0[/L]c1)= 1, ∃(s0 ∈ ℤ,((s0[^]2)[mod]c1)=(c0[mod]c1)), (¬ c1[||]c0 ∧ ∃(s0 ∈ ℤ, c1[||]((s0[^]2)[-]c0))))
  lgsqr(s0, c0, c1)
  adantld((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈(Prime \ { 2 })), ¬ c1[||]c0, ∃(s0 ∈ ℤ, c1[||]((s0[^]2)[-]c0)), ∃(s0 ∈ ℤ,((s0[^]2)[mod]c1)=(c0[mod]c1)))
  reximdva(s0, cz, (c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈(Prime \ { 2 })), c1[||]((s0[^]2)[-]c0), ((s0[^]2)[mod]c1)=(c0[mod]c1))
  biimprd(((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈(Prime \ { 2 }))∧ s0 ∈ ℤ), c1[||]((s0[^]2)[-]c0), ((s0[^]2)[mod]c1)=(c0[mod]c1))
  syl3anc(((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈(Prime \ { 2 }))∧ s0 ∈ ℤ), (((s0[^]2)[mod]c1)=(c0[mod]c1)↔ c1[||]((s0[^]2)[-]c0)), c1 ∈ ℕ, (s0[^]2)∈ ℤ, c0 ∈ ℤ)
  ad2antlr(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈(Prime \ { 2 }), s0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈ ℕ)
  syl(c1 ∈(Prime \ { 2 }), c1 ∈ ℕ, c1 ∈ Prime)
  eldifi(c1, cprime, { 2 })
  prmnn(c1)
  adantl((c0 ∈ ℤ ∧ c1 ∈(Prime \ { 2 })), s0 ∈ ℤ, (s0[^]2)∈ ℤ)
  zsqcl(s0)
  simpll(c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈(Prime \ { 2 }), s0 ∈ ℤ)
  moddvds(c1, (s0[^]2), c0)
  diff.wa.s(s0, c0 ∈ ℤ, c1 ∈(Prime \ { 2 }))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, cz)
  diff.cz.s(s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c1, (Prime \ { 2 }))
  diff.cdif.s(s0, cprime, { 2 })
  diff.cprime.s(s0)
  diff.csn.s(s0, nat2)

}

blocks.name: lgsqrmodndvds
blocks.content: If the Legendre symbol of an integer ` A ` for an odd prime is ` 1 ` , then the number is a quadratic residue ` mod P ` with a solution ` x ` of the congruence ` ( x ^ 2 ) == A ` (mod ` P ` ) which is not divisible by the prime. (Contributed by AV, 20-Aug-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 18-Mar-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm lgsqrmodndvds(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {

  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
} = {
  ex(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cdif(cprime, csn(nat2)))), wceq(co(c0, clgs, c1), nat1), wrex(s0, cz, wa(wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmo, c1), co(c0, cmo, c1)), wn(wbr(c1, cdvds, cv(s0))))))
  mpd(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cdif(cprime, csn(nat2)))), wceq(co(c0, clgs, c1), nat1)), wrex(s0, cz, wa(wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmo, c1), co(c0, cmo, c1)), wn(wbr(c1, cdvds, cv(s0))))), wrex(s0, cz, wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmo, c1), co(c0, cmo, c1))))
  imp(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cdif(cprime, csn(nat2)))), wceq(co(c0, clgs, c1), nat1), wrex(s0, cz, wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmo, c1), co(c0, cmo, c1))))
  lgsqrmod(s0, c0, c1)
  reximdva(s0, cz, wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cdif(cprime, csn(nat2)))), wceq(co(c0, clgs, c1), nat1)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmo, c1), co(c0, cmo, c1)), wa(wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmo, c1), co(c0, cmo, c1)), wn(wbr(c1, cdvds, cv(s0)))))
  ancld(wa(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cdif(cprime, csn(nat2)))), wceq(co(c0, clgs, c1), nat1)), wcel(cv(s0), cz)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmo, c1), co(c0, cmo, c1)), wn(wbr(c1, cdvds, cv(s0))))
  sylbid(wa(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cdif(cprime, csn(nat2)))), wceq(co(c0, clgs, c1), nat1)), wcel(cv(s0), cz)), wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmo, c1), co(c0, cmo, c1)), wn(wbr(c1, cdvds, cv(s0))), wbr(c1, cdvds, co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmin, c0)))
  syl3anc(wa(wa(wa(wcel(c0, cz), wcel(c1, cdif(cprime, csn(nat2)))), wceq(co(c0, clgs, c1), nat1)), wcel(cv(s0), cz)), wb(wceq(co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmo, c1), co(c0, cmo, c1)), wbr(c1, cdvds, co(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cmin, c0))), wcel(c1, cn), wcel(co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), cz), wcel(c0, cz))

  moddvds(c1, co(cv(s0), cexp, nat2), c0)

blocks.name: lgsdchrval
blocks.content: The Legendre symbol function ` X ( m ) = ( m /L N ) ` , where ` N ` is an odd positive number, is a Dirichlet character modulo ` N ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2016.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: lgsdchr
blocks.content: The Legendre symbol function ` X ( m ) = ( m /L N ) ` , where ` N ` is an odd positive number, is a real Dirichlet character modulo ` N ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Apr-2016.)
blocks.origin:
